subject: Travel
title: The Japanese Bow
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Japanese Bow.

hook.text: In Japan, the depth of your bow reveals the depth of your respect. Get it wrong, and you've offended someone.

buildup.text: A 15-degree bow is casual. A 30-degree bow is standard business. A 45-degree bow shows deep apology.

discovery.text: The person of lower status always bows deeper and longer. Eye contact during a bow is considered rude.

twist.text: Bowing extends to phone calls. Japanese people often bow while talking on the phone unconsciously.

climax.text: Train conductors bow to the passengers each time they enter or leave a train car.

punchline.text: In Japan, respect has an exact angle.

quiz.question: What does a 45-degree bow signify in Japan?
